intro: Impatiens konalarensis, commonly known as the Kona impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the genus Impatiens, which is part of the family Balsaminaceae. This species is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it an important component of the local flora.
